title: Designing Online Mathematics Learning Spaces and Project-Based Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Knowledge and Experience with Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Learners participate in online collaboration and project execution using personal devices, while instructors design interaction-facilitating environments based on modern learning theories; learners evaluate achievements through collaborative application of math problems to real-life projects

learning_goals: Learners successfully complete 80% or more of collaborative math projects using online tools.
Learners improve their ability to give and receive peer feedback by over 70% in project-based learning settings.

Over 1–6 months, learners will systematically record mathematical problem-solving processes (problem definition, solution steps, error analysis) in a digital portfolio (Google Sites or Notion) at least twice weekly. They will share feedback with three peer learners and meet at least four of the five final portfolio evaluation criteria.

resources: Online Collaboration Platforms (Google Workspace, Notion, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
